option.od: print the help message and exit.
log connections and information in the file logname. By default, connections are recorded in log.rt.
record the port number that the server is listening for connections on in the file portname. By default, the port is recorded in port.id.
record the process Identifier (PID) of the server in the file pidname. By default, the PID is recorded in pid.id.
force the server to listen on the local port number port. By default, the server requests a port number from the Operating System.

description.p: The task is a demonstration of a TCP/IP server. It waits for clients to connect and then sends a string containing the date and time to them every few seconds.

example.description: Listen for clients on a port allocated by the operating system. The port number is recorded in the file "port.id", the process identifier is recorded in the file "pid.id", and logs of all transactions are recorded in the file "log.xxx" where xxx is the day of the year.

Listen for clients on a port 5000. The port number is recorded in the file "port.id", the process identifier is recorded in the file "pid.id", and logs of all transactions are recorded in the file "log.xxx" where xxx is the day of the year.
